title: Building Stress Resilience
content: Stress resilience develops through preparation, practice, physical fitness, recovery time, and support systems. Resilient individuals and teams perform better under pressure because they've built capacity through deliberate investment. Resilience isn't innate—it's cultivated.

mcq.question: A team regularly practices high-stress scenarios. When a real emergency occurs, they perform well. What's the connection?

options.B: Practice built familiarity and confidence that enabled performance under stress
options.C: They were naturally suited for the work
options.D: Real emergencies are easier than practice

mcq.explanation: Practice under stress builds neural pathways and procedural familiarity that persist during real events. The stress response is less overwhelming when the tasks are well-practiced. Resilience comes from preparation, not personality.

openQuestions: How do you build stress resilience?
What practices help your team handle high-pressure situations?
